tagline: The Pakistan Electronic Media Regulatory Authority (PEMRA) is under obligation, both legally and morally, to issue licence to the petitioners because the reason which prevailed upon it for refusing to issue licence to the petitioners i.e. “security clearance” has not been accepted by the learned High Court, therefore, the petitioners who on the basis of their application waited for a period of more than 100 days, during which their application has not been rejected, have acquired a right that they should be dealt with in accordance with law as is envisaged under Article 4 of the Constitution. Any excuse now being made on behalf of the PEMRA is not acceptable.
